deco2800.arcade.chess

Interface Piece

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Null, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public interface Piece

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deActivate()
      Remove the piece from gameplay and send to the graveyard
      boolean getActiveState()
      Takes in a piece and returns a boolean based on whether the piece is still active or not
      boolean getFirstMove()
      Takes in a piece and returns a boolean based on whether it's taken it's first move
      int getPreference()
      Takes in a piece and returns it's numerical preference
      boolean getTeam()
      Takes in a piece and returns it's team as a boolean - False = white team - True = black team
      java.util.List<int[]> possibleMoves(int[] currentPos)
      Returns a list of all possible moves that the piece can make
      void reActivate()
      Add the piece back into gameplay and remove from the graveyard

    • Method Detail

      • possibleMoves

        java.util.List<int[]> possibleMoves(int[] currentPos)
        Returns a list of all possible moves that the piece can make
        Returns:
        List of the locations of all possible moves.

      • deActivate

        void deActivate()
        Remove the piece from gameplay and send to the graveyard

      • reActivate

        void reActivate()
        Add the piece back into gameplay and remove from the graveyard

      • getTeam

        boolean getTeam()
        Takes in a piece and returns it's team as a boolean - False = white team - True = black team
        Parameters:
        piece - The instance of the piece to check
        Returns:
        False if on the white team, true if on the black team

      • getFirstMove

        boolean getFirstMove()
        Takes in a piece and returns a boolean based on whether it's taken it's first move
        Parameters:
        piece - The instance of the piece to check
        Returns:
        True if piece has moved, false otherwise

      • getActiveState

        boolean getActiveState()
        Takes in a piece and returns a boolean based on whether the piece is still active or not
        Parameters:
        piece - The instance of the piece to check
        Returns:
        True if the piece is still in play, false otherwise

      • getPreference

        int getPreference()
        Takes in a piece and returns it's numerical preference
        Parameters:
        piece - The instance of the piece to check
        Returns:
        The integer value of the pieces preference
